title: Lint elided lifetimes when the argument that triggered the elision is not used

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
For example, this code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=07c3d723721532b46e50ea0ac16db8e3)):

```rust
fn test(s: &i32) -> &u32 {
    &0
}
```

will be desugared to:

```rust
fn test<'a>(s: &'a i32) -> &'a u32 {
    &0
}
```

which is probably not what the user intended, given that the return value does not use `s` at all.

On the other hand, this code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=5366a460e84e95359d42eaa40bee3605)):

```rust
fn test() -> &u32 {
    &0
}
```

will _not_ have lifetime elision because there are no arguments, and will give a friendly error that tells the user to add a lifetime.

**So essentially the proposal is to lint the first example (which compiles with no lifetime-related errors) with a similar warning to the error in the second example.**

---

And also, here's a potentially dangerous example that should be linted ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=ad12358f39e4cfa1dcdab6c8416d5d25)):

```rust
fn test(s: &i32, v: *const u32) -> &u32 {
    unsafe { &* v }
}
```

---

See the [discussion on Zulip](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/245100-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization.2Falerts/topic/I-prioritize.20.2377912.20Taking.20an.20argument.20hides.20lifetime.20error) for more.

Cc @lcnr @jyn514
